message.content:
Below is one way to account for all of the pieces in the scene and match them (without re‐orienting) to the dictionary blocks.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) ANALYSIS OF THE TARGET IMAGE
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

■ The scene shows two separate “buildings.”  

● LEFT BUILDING (“Tower”)
 • Bottom Layer (3 blocks)
   – A red “circular‐arch” block in the center  
   – One small yellow cube on the left  
   – One small yellow cube on the right  
 • Above that center arch are two cubes stacked (green on bottom, blue on top).  
 • Flanking that stack, on either side, are orange triangular wedges forming sloping walls.  
 • A final orange triangular piece caps the very top.  
 ⇒ In total, the left tower uses 8 pieces.

● RIGHT BUILDING (“Gateway”)
 • Two tall green pillars at the base (left and right).  
 • A wide yellow rectangular block bridging across the two pillars.  
 • A red arch block sitting atop that yellow beam (arch facing forward).  
 • Two orange triangular wedges forming the pitched roof on top.  
 ⇒ In total, the right gateway uses 6 pieces.

Hence there are 14 blocks total between the two structures.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) SELECTING BLOCKS FROM THE DICTIONARY
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one workable matching of each visible piece to a dictionary index.  
Remember we may reuse the same index multiple times if that exact orientation recurs.

● LEFT TOWER (8 blocks)
 1. #2  (Red “seat” block) – used as the circular‐arch center block on the bottom  
 2. #6  (Yellow cube) – bottom left  
 3. #6  (Yellow cube) – bottom right  
 4. #4  (Green cube) – stacked above the red arch  
 5. #3  (Blue cube) – on top of the green cube  
 6. #13 (Orange triangular) – left sloping wedge  
 7. #14 (Orange triangular) – right sloping wedge  
 8. #15 (Orange triangular) – the very top “roof” piece  

● RIGHT GATEWAY (6 blocks)
 1. #7  (Green pillar) – left pillar  
 2. #7  (Green pillar) – right pillar  
 3. #11 (Yellow rectangular prism) – spans the two pillars  
 4. #1  (Red arch) – sits on the yellow beam  
 5. #13 (Orange triangular) – left half of pitched roof  
 6. #14 (Orange triangular) – right half of pitched roof  

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
3) STEP‐BY‐STEP ASSEMBLY INSTRUCTIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

Below is one possible assembly order (from bottom up):

{
  Step1: Move block with index 2    (place red seat‐arch for left tower base)
  Step2: Move block with index 6    (left tower bottom left cube)
  Step3: Move block with index 6    (left tower bottom right cube)
  Step4: Move block with index 4    (green cube above the red seat‐arch)
  Step5: Move block with index 3    (blue cube on top of the green cube)
  Step6: Move block with index 13   (left orange wedge on tower)
  Step7: Move block with index 14   (right orange wedge on tower)
  Step8: Move block with index 15   (top orange wedge on tower)
  Step9: Move block with index 7    (left green pillar of gateway)
  Step10: Move block with index 7   (right green pillar of gateway)
  Step11: Move block with index 11  (yellow beam bridging the two green pillars)
  Step12: Move block with index 1   (red arch on top of the yellow beam)
  Step13: Move block with index 13  (left orange roof piece on gateway)
  Step14: Move block with index 14  (right orange roof piece on gateway)
}

This yields both the left “tower” and right “gateway” exactly as shown, using only the given orientations of the dictionary blocks.
